page.title: 04Annual Carnival
page.content: I go to Croxteth Carnival nearly every year. I usually enter the Fancy Dress Competition. There are always lots of activities there like the lucky dip, fancy dress parade, and choirs singing. Before it begins there is a walk around Croxteth. In 1981 there was a bus that had books in that you could read, and I won the Fancy Dress competition. I was dressed as Queen Elizabeth the First, and I won a little silver cup. It said on it "1981 Fancy Dress Competition." On the stalls are clothes that people have made and knitted and on others are food. Some stalls have games. I think it is very good. At the{Hey-Day,}which is held in the grounds of Croxteth Hall, there is a fair, and some stalls. There is a bar,too, where they sell beer & lager. Joanne Dowdall
